q: Simon Cowell is also excited to have kids as young as 12 years old audition- an opinion he didn't always have. American Idol? "I haven't seen a full episode," he said. I saw a three-minute recap. From what I've seen and from what I've heard, it all seems to be going well. And I always thought that would be the case. "What I was more concerned about was the ratings falling off a cliff, meaning that the whole genre might be over, Simon Cowell continued. "The good news is that people are still excited about these shows, whether it be... Dancing With the Stars, which has gotten better over the years, America's Got Talent.

Star interviews: Everyone wants to hear from Michael Vick and DeSean Jackson and Asante Samuel . That's the problem: their interviews are usually done in massive groups with serious reporters and lazy ones competing to get questions in.( How important is winning this week? Really?) It's not exactly conducive to revealing statements. Lesser-known players, who you might be able to actually have a conversation with, more often provided far deeper insight. The road: Great

The Insurance Institute for Highway Safety and others have questioned whetherbanning texting behind the wheel orusing a hand-held cell phone reduces traffic accidents. Ray LaHood responded Thursday by saying, there are some who would like to derail our work spotlighting the dangers of texting or talking on the phone while driving. I want them to know that our fight to end distracted driving will not be deterred. Ray LaHood has been on a self-described "rampage" on the issue in the wake of harrowing stories of motorists killed by drivers who were texting or talking on a phone.
